headline: Heard on the Street Recap: AMD Circles Back
summary: OpenAI and chip-designer Advanced Micro Devices announced a multibillion-dollar partnership.  OpenAI committed to purchasing 6 gigawatts worth of AMD’s chips and will also receive warrants for up to 160 million AMD shares, roughly 10% of the chip company, if OpenAI hits certain milestones for deployment.  Two regional banks will merge in a $10.9 billion deal.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: AMD Circles Back
content.summary: OpenAI and chip-designer Advanced Micro Devices announced a multibillion-dollar partnership.  OpenAI committed to purchasing 6 gigawatts worth of AMD’s chips and will also receive warrants for up to 160 million AMD shares, roughly 10% of the chip company, if OpenAI hits certain milestones for deployment.  Two regional banks will merge in a $10.9 billion deal.

headline: Fifth-Third to acquire Comerica in $10.9 billion bank merger
summary: Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB) is on track to acquire regional bank Comerica (CMA) in a deal valued at $10.9 billion that could end up forming the ninth-largest in the US. Yahoo Finance senior banking reporter David Hollerith joins Josh Lipton to expand upon the details of the bank merger and what it means for Fifth Third's expansion plans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Fifth-Third to acquire Comerica in $10.9 billion bank merger
content.description:
Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB) is on track to acquire regional bank Comerica (CMA) in a deal valued at $10.9 billion that could end up forming the ninth-largest in the US.

Yahoo Finance senior banking reporter David Hollerith joins Josh Lipton to expand upon the details of the bank merger and what it means for Fifth Third's expansion plans.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Fifth Third to buy Comerica for $10.9 billion in biggest US bank deal of the year
summary:
Fifth Third has agreed to purchase Dallas-based Comerica for $10.9 billion, the regional banks said Monday. 
Pending regulatory approval, the deal would create the nation's ninth-largest bank, with $288 billion in assets.

content.title: Fifth Third to buy Comerica for $10.9 billion in biggest US bank deal of the year

Pending regulatory approval, the deal would create the nation's ninth-largest bank, with $288 billion in assets.

headline: Fifth Third, Comerica Combine To Form Ninth-Largest US Bank
summary: Comerica Incorporated (NYSE:CMA) shares are trading higher premarket on Monday after Fifth Third Bancorp (NASDAQ:FITB) agreed to merge with the company in an all-stock deal valued at $10.9 billion. As per the terms, Comerica shareholders will receive 1.8663 Fifth Third shares for each Comerica share. The offer price is equivalent to $82.88 per share based on Fifth Third’s October 3, 2025, closing price and represents a 20% premium to Comerica’s 10-day volume-weighted average. The combined entity

headline: Fifth Third Bancorp to buy Comerica for $10.9 billion in tie-up of big regional banks
summary: Fifth Third Bancorp is buying Comerica for $10.9 billion in an all-stock deal, tying up two big regional banks.  The combined company will have operations in the Southeast, Texas and California, and will greatly solidify Fifth Third's position in the Midwest.  It is anticipated that over half of Fifth Third’s branches will be located in the Southeast, Texas, Arizona and California by 2030.

content.title: Fifth Third Bancorp to buy Comerica for $10.9 billion in tie-up of big regional banks
content.summary: Fifth Third Bancorp is buying Comerica for $10.9 billion in an all-stock deal, tying up two big regional banks.  The combined company will have operations in the Southeast, Texas and California, and will greatly solidify Fifth Third's position in the Midwest.  It is anticipated that over half of Fifth Third’s branches will be located in the Southeast, Texas, Arizona and California by 2030.

headline: Fifth Third to Acquire Comerica
summary: CINCINNATI & DALLAS, October 06, 2025--Fifth Third Bancorp (Nasdaq: FITB) and Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) today announced that they have entered into a definitive merger agreement under which Fifth Third will acquire Comerica in an all-stock transaction valued at $10.9 billion. Under the terms of the agreement, Comerica’s stockholders will receive 1.8663 Fifth Third shares for each Comerica share, representing $82.88 per share as of Fifth Third’s closing stock price on October 3, 2025, and

content.title: Fifth Third to Acquire Comerica
content.summary: CINCINNATI & DALLAS, October 06, 2025--Fifth Third Bancorp (Nasdaq: FITB) and Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) today announced that they have entered into a definitive merger agreement under which Fifth Third will acquire Comerica in an all-stock transaction valued at $10.9 billion. Under the terms of the agreement, Comerica’s stockholders will receive 1.8663 Fifth Third shares for each Comerica share, representing $82.88 per share as of Fifth Third’s closing stock price on October 3, 2025, and
